glsa.title: Common Data Format library: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in the Common Data Format library.

background.p: The Common Data Format library is a scientific data management package which allows programmers and application developers to manage and manipulate scalar, vector, and multi-dimensional data arrays in a platform independent fashion.

description.p: Alfredo Ortega (Core Security Technologies) reported a boundary error within the Read32s_64() function when processing CDF files.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted CDF file, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
